case_title: KORA KHAN vs DIRECTOR-GENERAL AGRICULTURE DEPARTMENT, GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN and another
respondant: Director-General Agriculture Department, Government of Balochistan

accussed_details.name: Kora Khan
allegation: Murder of Din Muhammad under Section 302 PPC

complaint_summary: The appellant, Kora Khan, was accused of murder under Section 302 PPC based on an FIR lodged by Essab Khan. He was acquitted by the trial court, appellate court, and Supreme Court.
investigation_summary: An FIR was lodged against Kora Khan alleging murder. After investigation, a challan was submitted, and the trial concluded with his acquittal. Subsequent appeals by the complainant were dismissed by higher courts.
judgment_summary: The tribunal accepted the appeal, reinstating Kora Khan in service without back benefits. His absence was deemed non-wilful, resulting from false allegations.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal accepted; reinstatement without back benefits.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued that absence was due to false allegations and acquittal was honorable.
Prosecution argued absence was not justified and acquittal was not honorable.
Tribunal ruled absence was non-wilful and acquittal was honorable.
sections: Section 4 of Balochistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974
key_issues: Whether the appellant's absence from duty was wilful.
Entitlement to reinstatement and back benefits.

maxims.Wilful: Voluntary, knowingly, and deliberate; not accidental or involuntary.

legal_terms.Acquittal: A legal judgment that officially clears an accused of criminal charges.

words_and_phrases.Extraordinary Leave Without Pay: A period of absence from duty without salary, granted under special circumstances.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the wrongful termination of Kora Khan due to absence caused by false criminal allegations. The tribunal ruled the absence was non-wilful and reinstated him without back benefits, emphasizing the honorable nature of his acquittal.
